title: LookAgain.fun - a community spot the difference puzzle AI game
subtitle: AI-powered web game where users describe any scene in text, and the app generates two nearly identical images with hidden differences.
description:
AI-powered web game where users describe any scene in text, and the app generates two nearly identical images with hidden differences.

LookAgain is an AI-powered spot-the-difference game that demonstrates the precision of the Nano Banana model in controlled image editing. Instead of producing unrelated images, the system generates a photorealistic base scene and then applies small, localized edits with high accuracy. The result is a pair of images that remain visually consistent while containing subtle, well-defined differences—ideal for interactive puzzle gameplay and a strong showcase of AI’s capability for fine-grained image manipulation.

Initial Generation: User text prompts are expanded into high-detail, photorealistic images using imagen-4.0-generate-001.

title: VibeMooding - Vibe Code your home decor
subtitle: VibeMooding is an home decoration app that allows users to upload an image of their rooms and generate realistic and consistent decorations.
description:
VibeMooding is an home decoration app that allows users to upload an image of their rooms and generate realistic and consistent decorations.

"VibeMooding" is an application designed to simplify interior decoration by transforming an empty or existing space into a harmonious environment. The main challenge lies in generating consistent and realistic decoration ideas from a single photo — a task where traditional AI tools often struggle, producing perspective issues and stylistic inconsistencies that fall into the "uncanny valley."

At the beginning of this solution is Gemini 2.5 flash, chosen specifically for its speed and broad knowledge and ability to generate cohesive "mood proposals."

title: Synesthesia Canvas
subtitle: Synesthesia Canvas - Your voice is the paintbrush. Your words are the subject.
description:
Synesthesia Canvas is an immersive, real-time generative art application that transforms the human voice into a dynamic visual masterpiece. Our project explores a novel form of human-computer interaction, translating ephemeral audio data—such as spoken words, vocal tone, and volume—into a persistent and continuously evolving piece of digital art.

To further enhance this multi-sensory experience, we integrate the Eleven Labs API to generate both a poetic AI art critic's voice and an ambient, atmospheric soundscape that sonically matches the visual art, creating a full synesthetic feedback loop for the user.

The app is currently using free tiers with temporary "burner API keys" that will be disabled after the event for security reasons. Rate limiting may apply to ElevenLabs API.

title: Banana Split Stories
subtitle: A web-based, D&D-style generative adventure game.
description:
Banana Split Stories is a generative adventure game where you don't just play the hero—you become them. Built in 48 hours for the Nano Banana Hackathon, our application casts players directly into their own unique, cinematic story.

Our application, Banana Split Stories, is built entirely around the core strengths of the Gemini 2.5 Flash Image model, using it not as a simple image generator, but as a dynamic, context-aware "render engine" for a narrative experience.

The magic begins with the photorealistic editing and in-painting features. When a user uploads their selfie, we send a highly instructional prompt that commands the model to act as a photo editor, preserving the user's face while seamlessly replacing their clothing and background to match the chosen game theme. This creates a visually consistent character asset that maintains the player's likeness.

description:

The application showcases how generative AI can transform creative and commercial workflows, making professional-quality branding accessible to everyone, regardless of design expertise. With BrandGen, entrepreneurs, artists, and marketing professionals can rapidly move from idea to execution, using AI to automate early-stage creative ideation and establish a strong foundation for their brand.

Text-to-Image Generation: From a single text prompt, the model produces unique logos and social media ad concepts—turning simple ideas into professional visual assets.

title: Architecture Visualizer
subtitle: Visualize Architecture Plans
description:
The architectural design process is often hindered by a significant bottleneck: visualization. Translating 2D blueprints or basic 3D models into photorealistic renderings is a costly, time-consuming task requiring expert knowledge of complex software. This friction limits a designer's ability to rapidly iterate and communicate their vision effectively to clients.

The magic of our Nano Banana model lies in its two core, fine-tuned strengths: unwavering consistency and precise instruction following. It strictly adheres to the spatial constraints of the uploaded blueprint, which ensuring walls, windows, and doors are accurately placed. It also is great at applying the specified stylistic instructions from the text, such as 'brutalist concrete interior' or 'art deco lighting.' This fusion of capabilities transforms a days-long process into mere seconds, making photorealistic architectural visualization truly accessible and iterative.

Ryan Scovill. Architecture Visualizer. https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/banana/writeups/magical-architecture-visualizer. 2025. Kaggle

title: Tsuzuku Mirai
subtitle: AI-Powered Future Storytelling with Nano Banana
description:
Our project, Tsuzuku Mirai, explores how AI can transform a single static image into a living, branching narrative. At its core, the system leverages Gemini 2.5 Flash Image for two critical functions: first, to analyze the uploaded image in detail—capturing its story context, visual style, and cinematic framing—and second, to generate creative directions for possible futures. These directions are then passed to Nano Banana, which produces the corresponding future images.

What makes this application unique is that it does not simply generate variations of what the user explicitly requests. Instead, the AI interprets the meaning and mood within the original image, and then proposes future scenarios that extend naturally from it. Each decision point presents two paths—one realistic and one dramatic—allowing users to actively shape the evolution of the story.

This combination of AI-driven interpretation and predictive storytelling creates an experience that goes beyond image generation: it turns user input into a living narrative canvas. By blending Gemini’s analysis with Nano Banana’s generative power, Tsuzuku Mirai demonstrates how AI can move from passive tool to active storytelling partner.

title: MediVision
subtitle: Drug Action Visualizer - bridges the gap between medical jargon and everyday understanding which builds trust and transparency with patients
description:
Drug Action Visualizer - bridges the gap between medical jargon and everyday understanding which builds trust and transparency with patients

Patients often struggle to understand how their medications actually work. Doctors explain mechanisms, but terms like “insulin sensitivity” or "antibiotic resistance” are abstract and hard to visualize. This lack of understanding can lead to confusion, fear, or poor medication adherence.
MediVision solves this by transforming medical prescriptions and drug names into intuitive, metaphorical visuals powered by Gemini 2.5 Flash Image (aka nano banana). Patients can upload a doctor’s prescription or type a medication name, and instantly see a personalized image sequence:

Gemini’s world knowledge enables it to represent complex drug mechanisms symbolically. Its fusion and consistency capabilities ensure the same body, cells, or “drug characters” remain visually coherent across before/after, time-lapse healing journeys, or even polypharmacy dashboards where multiple drugs are shown working together.

title: AI Fantasy Map Generator
subtitle: Hallucinated maps to downplay the AI revolution, get your hallucinated maps here!
description:
Hallucinated maps to downplay the AI revolution, get your hallucinated maps here!

My submission is a play on one of the popularly highlighted 'deficiencies' of vision language models. Often, maps generated with image models are unrealistic and prone to inaccuracies or hallucinations. Rather than that being annoying, however, I find that incredibly interesting, it's like a window to an alternative reality. For my hackathon project, I took the opportunity to explore AI Studio alongside Gemini Flash Pro 2.5. I wanted to see if it would be possible to easily use Google Maps as a reference point for generating fantasy maps. I used AI studio's image generator template, meaning I was working with typescript, a language I have little experience with. I have used the Google Maps API a little but the structure has changed a lot and there's some new functionality. Once I got the original idea working - turning a google maps image into a fantasy map, I experimented with adding a search functionality, as well as with a number of different prompts. Given how easy it was to work with Gemini and AI studio, I ended up creating different CSS templates for the different types of fantasy map. Prompts are hidden behind an icon to reduce the complexity of the user experience - I wanted to focus the user on choosing a location that was meaningful or well known to them, rather than constructing the perfect prompt.
I think it worked out well - the places API is used to help users find a location, and then three different maps - an unlabelled street map, a labelled street map and a terrain map are passed to 'nano banana'. Another thing I could have tried is perhaps adding a temperature slider, using additional APIs (such as the pollen API for the mushroom kingdom or the complex Earth API) or allowing further balancing between different maps. However, I like this project as it's the first hackathon in a while where I haven't felt any pressure and stress. Google maps is a tool that I use every day, but I think its cool it itself started as a sort of side project. Anyway, hope you enjoy!

alex casper. AI Fantasy Map Generator. https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/banana/writeups/ai-fantasy-map-generator. 2025. Kaggle

subtitle: EchoReach is an AI-powered growth assistant that transforms a creator’s YouTube videos or content links into full promotional campaigns.
description:
EchoReach is an AI-powered growth assistant that transforms a creator’s YouTube videos or content links into full promotional campaigns.

EchoReach – The Future of One-Click Campaigns
EchoReach is the first AI-powered growth kit that transforms a single YouTube transcript into a complete campaign journey. Instead of just spitting out captions or cutting clips, EchoReach generates cinematic storyboards — detailed prompts with visuals, voiceovers, and text overlays — that creators can instantly bring to life with tools like Veo3.
From one transcript, creators get:
Video Storyboards → ready-to-generate ads and shorts.
Social Posts → tailored for X, Threads, LinkedIn.
Ad Creatives → brand-ready slogans and banners.
Campaign Plan → when and where to post for maximum reach.
Unlike anything else, EchoReach doesn’t just repurpose content — it reimagines it into stories that scale across platforms. This is the future of campaign creation: one transcript → one dashboard → endless growth.

title: Try On Studio

description:
It allows users to try on their own clothes and present ready-made models for studios, allowing them to edit their clothes on models.

TryOn Studio is an AI-powered virtual try-on web app built with Next.js (App Router) and TypeScript that lets users dress a default male/female model—or their own photo—with single garments or coordinated upper+lower outfits, preserving the original background and identity while realistically replacing clothes and logos/prints; it features a smooth Model Viewer (zoom/pan/reset), an AI Edit Panel for non-destructive, prompt-based refinements with history, full i18n (TR/EN), and robust backend endpoints (e.g., /api/nano-banana for upper/lower/dress and multi-garment flows) secured via environment variables and designed with strong validation, detailed logging, and a clean, maintainable UI.

Esref Zeki PARLAK. Try On Studio. https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/banana/writeups/tryon-studio. 2025. Kaggle

title: Silent Comic Strip Generator
subtitle: Silent Comic Strip Generator
description:
The application leverages a dual-Gemini model architecture to generate wordless, visually-driven comics with a strong artistic style. The process begins with Gemini 2.5 Pro, which transforms simple user text input into a series of highly detailed, long-form narrative prompts. The core of our application, however, relies on Gemini 2.5 Flash Image. Two of its features are central to our functionality:

Adherence to Long, Detailed Prompts: This capability is crucial for maintaining narrative and stylistic consistency across multiple comic panels. It allows the model to accurately render the complex scenes, character emotions, and specific artistic elements essential for silent storytelling.

Powerful Creative Generation: Flash’s creativity is indispensable for establishing the unique, compelling visual identity of the comics, breathing life into the story with imaginative and artistically rich imagery.

title: 3D Effects with Cross Eye Sterogram
subtitle: Generate Sterogram of your image
description:
Nano Banana is the first model with strong enough spatial intelligence to reliably achieve this task. In fact, the stereogram pipeline itself could serve as a benchmark test of spatial reasoning for future vision models, since success depends on consistent subject rendering, accurate scale, and precise multi-view perspective.

At its core, the app relies on Gemini’s sophisticated image-and-text understanding, executed through a two-step transformation pipeline. First, whether starting from a text prompt or an uploaded photo, Gemini regenerates the subject in a consistent isometric view against a clean background, demonstrating its ability to interpret and execute complex spatial instructions. Next, this image is reprocessed to generate a second view from a slightly shifted perspective, mimicking the parallax effect required for stereoscopic depth perception. The model’s ability to maintain subject consistency while subtly altering the point of view is what makes the final 3D illusion possible.

Because this workflow is entirely model-driven, it can be easily adapted to VR headsets or AR goggles, where dynamically generated stereograms would enhance immersion and open new possibilities for interactive 3D media experiences. Nano Banana not only powers stereogram generation today but also establishes a pathway toward spatially intelligent applications of the future.

title: Virtual Try-On App for Online & Offline Shopping
subtitle: Seamless fashion try-ons with Nano Banana - share, snap, or upload clothes and preview them instantly on you.
description:
Shopping for clothes online or in-store often comes with uncertainty, Will this outfit suit me? How will it look when I wear it? These doubts lead to poor buying decisions, wasted time in trial rooms, and high return rates for e-commerce platforms.

This was the most challenging part to build. Most e-commerce apps allow users to share products with a single tap, so I leveraged that by integrating a share sheet in TryOn AI to capture incoming product links. The real challenge, however, was ensuring a seamless flow by automatically retrieving the product image. To solve this, I built a custom backend service that combines social Open Graph (OG) image extraction with a fallback mechanism, to ensure the correct product image is fetched and returned reliably for every shared link.

My goal is to make shopping smarter, personal, and more fun. TryOn AI reduces uncertainty, saves time, and helps users explore styles without hesitation. By combining Nano Banana with a seamless user experience, It is reimagination of how people interact with fashion.

title: Smile Design Studio: AI-Powered Visuals for Dental Patient Consultation
subtitle: A chairside AI visualizer for dentists: snap a patient photo and, in seconds, show a hyper-real “after” preview of post dental procedure
description:
Patients struggle to visualise dental procedure (such as orthodontic or veneer) outcomes, causing confusion, misaligned expectations, and slow consent.

This was hard before. Chairside mock-ups meant manual masking, warping, shade matching, and compositing in Photoshop/CAD—error-prone spillover onto lips/skin, lighting mismatches, and 20–60 minutes per case, making real-time consultation impractical.

.
Our app feeds the patient photo plus a pre-designed dental procedure prompt (e.g., “align incisors; apply veneers”). Gemini 2.5 Flash Image performs mask-free, instruction-based local edits—context-aware inpainting that targets teeth while preserving face and background. It leverages Gemini’s world knowledge for semantically correct adjustments; all with low-latency ‘Flash’ performance suitable for chairside use.

description:

Gemini 2.5 Flash Image powers the “semantic augmentation” tier of our Albumentations MCP server. We showcase two core capabilities:

Image-conditioned editing (text+image→image). The server sends an original photo plus a structured edit prompt (e.g., “add a knitted wizard hat; preserve identity, pose, lighting”). This enables context-aware changes that deterministic augmentations can’t provide: background/time-of-day swaps, subtle style shifts, or element add/remove. title: Interior AI Decorator
subtitle: Prototype
description:
The Interior AI Decorator is a creative tool designed to take the guesswork out of home decorating. It allows you to use a photo of your own room as a digital canvas, making it easy to experiment with new furniture and decor before you commit to a purchase.
How It Works:
Upload & Analyze: You start by uploading a picture of any room in your house. The application uses a powerful AI to instantly analyze the image and identify key objects like sofas, chairs, tables, and lamps. These detected items become interactive, highlighted with a subtle outline.
Get Inspired: By clicking on any detected object, such as your current coffee table, the app presents you with visual ideas for replacements. In its current prototype stage, it shows a curated collection of inspirational images to spark your creativity.
Swap & Visualize: The core feature is the "magic swap." You can tell the AI which item you want to replace (e.g., "the blue armchair") and what you want to replace it with (e.g., "a modern leather wingback chair"). The AI then edits your original photo, seamlessly swapping the old item for the new one while maintaining the room's original lighting and perspective.
This process allows you to see exactly how a new piece of furniture would look in your space, transforming a typically difficult decision into a fun and interactive experience.
Prospects: Finding Real Products in Online Stores
The current "Find Similar Items" feature is a prototype that demonstrates the user experience with a fixed set of images. However, the ultimate vision for this application is to connect this visual discovery directly to real products available for purchase online. The potential here is enormous, effectively bridging the gap between inspiration and commerce.
The Path Forward:
The key to achieving this lies in leveraging AI-powered visual search. Instead of just identifying an object as a "chair," the technology can analyze its specific visual characteristics—its color, shape, style, and texture—and then search the web for commercially available products that look just like it.
How It Would Work Technically:
When a user clicks on an object in their photo, the app would:
Crop the Object: Isolate the specific pixels of the selected item (e.g., the user's current sofa).
Send to AI Search: Send this cropped image to an AI model equipped with a real-time web search tool (like the Google Search grounding in the Gemini API).
Perform a Visual Query: The AI's prompt would be, "Perform a visual search on Google Shopping for products that look like this image."
Return Real Results: The AI would then return a list of the top matching products, complete with their actual names, image URLs from the retailer, and direct links to the product page.
Challenges and Opportunities:
Accuracy is Key: The success of this feature depends entirely on the accuracy of the visual match. Finding a generic "blue sofa" is easy, but finding one that matches the specific style (e.g., Mid-Century Modern) and shade of the user's intended design is the real challenge. Continued advancements in AI are rapidly improving this.
API Reliability: As we experienced during development, making complex AI requests that involve image analysis, web searches, and structured data formatting can sometimes fail. Building a robust system requires sophisticated error handling and prompt engineering to ensure the AI returns reliable data every time.
A Seamless User Experience: The goal is to create a frictionless path from seeing an item in your room to finding a similar one to buy. This would transform the app from a simple editing tool into an invaluable assistant for interior design and shopping.
In conclusion, the prospect of integrating real-time product search is not a distant dream; the technology is already here. By refining the AI's instructions and building a resilient system, the Interior AI Decorator can evolve into a powerful platform that lets you redecorate your virtual space and then purchase the exact items you need to bring that vision to life.

title: AI Pose and Sticker Generator (by thisiskiet)

description:
My web app directly provides an intuitive, no-code platform for on-the-fly image and sticker generation. Hope you find it helpful.

Creating diverse, stylized visuals for any character is a major bottleneck for content creators, marketers, and developers, demanding significant time and artistic skill. My web app solves this by transforming the process into an intuitive, on-demand experience, built entirely upon the capabilities of Gemini 2.5 Pro and Nano Banana within Google AI Studio.
The application's core is a powerful demonstration of Gemini 1.5 Pro's ability to perform complex, multi-conditioned image generation. It expertly synthesizes up to three distinct inputs: a Subject Photo for visual grounding, a Pose Reference for structural guidance, and an optional Style Choice for artistic transformation. This showcases Gemini's sophisticated multimodal reasoning, seamlessly merging a character's identity with a new pose and art style (e.g., "LEGO", "Pixar Style") in a single generative step.
Furthermore, the "Sticker Set" mode highlights Gemini's capacity for efficient batch processing, generating up to 10 unique poses in a single run. title: One Pic + One Click = 3D Models!
subtitle: Transform a single image into a 3D model with Nano Banana x Fal
description:
Inspiration:
The numbers don't lie—Shopify reports that 3D product models boost conversion rates by 94%. But creating these models remains painfully slow and expensive, requiring specialized software and actual 3D modeling skills. Most online sellers are stuck with flat photos while their customers squint and guess. We figured there had to be a better way.

What it does:
This tool takes any product photo and turns it into an interactive 3D model that customers can actually rotate and inspect.
The process is straightforward: drag in a product image (or paste a URL if you're feeling fancy), and the system generates missing camera angles, then builds a complete 3D model. Users get a browser-based 3D viewer plus downloadable assets for their store. The whole thing takes about a minute, which beats the traditional approach of hiring a 3D artist or learning Blender.

(And when I say "how we built it," I'm giving myself too much credit, since Gemini 2.5 Pro (in the Google Studio App Builder) did all the heavy lifting. What a time to be alive!)

title: New Idea Please!
subtitle: New Idea Please!
description:
My project "New Idea Please!" is an experimental digital drawing canvas that helps artists break through creative blocks by blending their practice with Gemini AI image generation. When an artist isn’t sure what to paint, they can summon wild, unexpected visual references generated by AI—sparks that serve as inspiration rather than finished outputs.

Instead of writing long, complex prompts, the canvas offers a dial-like interface: artists simply select an area of their drawing for the AI to riff on, and turn the dial to navigate through variations, as if steering around the latent space of imagination. This intuitive interaction feels more like exploring a sketchbook of possibilities than engineering prompts, keeping the focus on creative flow rather than technical details.

Under the hood, the system is powered by Gemini-2.5-flash-image, enabling fast, high-quality visual generations that stays consistent with the artist's style. The result is a tool that doesn’t replace the artist, but instead acts as a playful collaborator—offering unexpected imagery, textures, and moods that can be reinterpreted, remixed, and painted into original works.

Helix Editor is a revolutionary AI-powered image editor designed to transform the creative workflow. Moving beyond the limitations of linear editing, where past ideas are often lost, Helix introduces a non-destructive, branching methodology. This innovative approach visualizes the entire creative process as an interactive tree, where every edit generates new possibilities without overwriting the original path.

Using simple text prompts, creators can generate endless variations of their work. Each new generation branches off, creating an intuitive map of the project's evolution. This visual "helix" preserves the complete lineage, allowing users to explore multiple artistic directions simultaneously.

title: Furni AI — Design Your Home. Your Way.
subtitle: Furni AI lets you visualize stunning interiors in seconds.
description:
Furni AI leverages the advanced Gemini 2.5 Flash Image model to redefine the way people design their living spaces. At its core, the app uses Gemini’s fast, high-quality image understanding and generation to process user-uploaded room photos with remarkable accuracy. This ensures walls, floors, lighting, and spatial layouts are recognized instantly, allowing furniture to be placed in a way that feels natural and realistic.

The image-to-image transformation capability is central to the experience — users can upload their own furniture images or select from design presets, and Gemini 2.5 Flash seamlessly integrates them into the environment. Features like object detection and segmentation allow the model to identify existing furniture and preserve it, while intelligently placing new pieces without overlap or distortion.

Additionally, Gemini’s style adaptation and rendering speed enable Furni AI to provide multiple design variations in seconds, giving users the freedom to experiment with colors, layouts, and aesthetics effortlessly. This speed and realism are what deliver the “wow” moment to users, making interior design feel instant and accessible.

title: TerraForm 3D: AI-Powered Topographic Relief Maps
subtitle: diverse 2D geographical datasets into intuitive and highly detailed 3D relief maps
description:
diverse 2D geographical datasets into intuitive and highly detailed 3D relief maps

The challenge of transforming diverse 2D geographical datasets into intuitive and highly detailed 3D relief maps often involves complex data processing and artistic interpretation. Our "TerraForm 3D" project leverages the advanced capabilities of Gemini 2.5 Flash Image features to overcome these hurdles.
Specifically, Gemini's rapid image analysis capabilities are central to efficiently interpreting raw topographical data, such as Digital Elevation Models (DEMs) and satellite imagery. This allows for quick extraction of elevation contours, land cover types, and hydrographic features, crucial for accurate 3D mesh generation. Furthermore, Flash Image assists in generating realistic or stylized textures and applying them dynamically to the 3D models, enhancing visual fidelity based on geographical context. The "Flash" aspect ensures near real-time processing, making the creation of detailed relief maps responsive and accessible, whether for scientific visualization, educational tools, or personalized topographical art. This intelligent data interpretation and visual synthesis are at the core of our application, providing a seamless transition from abstract data to tangible 3D landscapes.
Attached Video Demo:
An engaging video demonstrating the TerraForm 3D project in action, showcasing the seamless generation of 3D relief maps from raw data and highlighting interactive elements.
Attached Public Project Link:
Explore our working product and interact with the AI-generated 3D relief maps firsthand. This link provides access to the application where judges can experience the project directly.

The e-commerce industry faces a critical bottleneck: professional product photography. Traditional photo shoots cost $200-500 per product, require 2-4 weeks turnaround time, and demand significant logistical coordination. Small businesses and individual sellers are particularly disadvantaged, often settling for amateur product photos that hurt conversion rates.
RetailVision leverages Gemini 2.5 Flash Image's unique capabilities to democratize professional product photography, reducing costs by 90% and turnaround time from weeks to minutes.

title: Comic Weaver
subtitle: Interactive comics where your choices shape the genre.
description:
Comic Weaver is an interactive comic story maker where the user decides the genre and ending. I use nano-banana as a director and story-boarder. In a single multimodal call, it returns a clean 2×3 comic page (no text) and strict JSON describing six panel visuals, short narratives, four mood‑biased choices, and any new NPCs. That directing pass sets the visual language—character design, palette, lighting, and environment.
Next, I ask nano‑banana to re‑create each panel as a standalone 4:3 image using the full page as a visual reference. Because nano‑banana accepts image inputs, I attach the storyboard page and optional character/NPC portraits to preserve identity and continuity, and I pass per‑panel cinematography specs (shot, angle, lens, composition) from the JSON. When a mood vector reaches 1.0, I batch‑render the ending panels for cohesive closure.
For audio, I have Gemini draft a chapter ambience brief and per‑panel SFX/stinger prompts; ElevenLabs renders background music or subtle ambience plus targeted SFX. Overall, the app leans on nano‑banana’s image+text in one response, reference conditioning from images, and multi‑image outputs to turn one directing pass into a consistent, playable comic.

Alimaa Ochkhuu. Comic Weaver. https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/banana/writeups/comic-weaver. 2025. Kaggle

title: InkSynth - See it Before the Needle Inks it.
subtitle: InkSynth is a generative AI-powered virtual tattoo studio that allows you to realistically try on tattoo designs on your own photos.
description:
InkSynth is a generative AI-powered virtual tattoo studio that allows you to realistically try on tattoo designs on your own photos.

The InkSynth application is entirely dependent on the unique capabilities of the Gemini 2.5 Flash Image model; it would not be possible with standard image editing tools. The model is central because it acts as a sophisticated visual reasoning engine, not just a generator.

At its core, InkSynth’s magic lies in the model's advanced multi-modal understanding. It simultaneously interprets a user's body photograph, one or more tattoo designs, and a complex text prompt filled with strict rules. This ability to synthesize instructions across different data types is what allows for photorealistic results. For the simulator, this means Gemini isn't just "pasting" a tattoo. It's performing a high-fidelity in-painting task, meticulously following textual commands to warp the design to the body's contours, mimic skin texture, and realistically adapt to the original photo's lighting and shadows.

description:
AI-Powered Blueprint to Interactive 3D Model – Precision Editing via Nano Banana's Image Fusion & Text-to-Edit

Imagine transforming a simple 2D mechanical blueprint into an interactive 3D model in seconds – no CAD expertise required. That's my Nano Banana Hackathon entry: 2D-to-3D CAD Converter. Using Gemini 2.5 Flash Image (Nano Banana), this web app extracts dimensions from uploaded images (PNG/JPG), generates 3D models, and enables real-time interaction. Drawing from my mechanical design background, I prioritized accuracy to bridge legacy drawings and modern prototyping, ideal for e-commerce visualization, education, and engineering workflows. Currently, it handles simple models; a precision version is in development but wasn't ready for this hackathon.

The result is a Three.js-powered interactive view, letting users rotate, zoom, and toggle wireframe mode to inspect models dynamically.

subtitle: Your Goto AI Tool for generating high quality visual experiences/Storyboards from Music or Audio Stories
description:
Your Goto AI Tool for generating high quality visual experiences/Storyboards from Music or Audio Stories

Synesthesia AI is an innovative creative suite designed to materialize sound into sight, offering a novel medium for storytelling and expression. My application empowers users to translate the abstract world of audio into tangible, beautiful visual art through two powerful features. The Creator Studio acts as a digital canvas where users can generate a single masterpiece from music, voice recording, or text, and then iteratively refine it with powerful editing and image-remixing capabilities. The Visual Storyboard feature elevates this concept by automatically deconstructing a longer audio narrative into a sequence of key visual moments, generating a complete pictorial story accompanied by a written summary. Synesthesia AI serves as a powerful bridge between the auditory and visual worlds, allowing creators to truly see their sound.

At its core, Gemini 2.5 Flash acts as the application's analytical "brain." Its powerful multimodal audio understanding is central to our features. It intelligently processes user-uploaded audio—from instrumental music to spoken stories even on the spot voice recording —to generate contextually rich and evocative image prompts. In the "Visual Storyboard" feature, it sequentially analyzes audio segments to build a narrative arc and synthesizes a final story summary, demonstrating its deep comprehension abilities.

title: VizCom: Visualize & Shop Instantly
subtitle: An AI tool that lets users try on styles, redesign spaces, or edit their look—and instantly connect those ideas with real products they can
description:
An AI tool that lets users try on styles, redesign spaces, or edit their look—and instantly connect those ideas with real products they can

Today, people struggle to imagine how products will look on them or in their environment before making a purchase. Buying clothes online often leads to uncertainty about fit and style. Choosing furniture or décor is challenging without knowing how it will blend with a real space. Even makeup or design choices are difficult to visualize without trying them first. This gap between imagination and reality creates friction, hesitation, and high product return rates in e-commerce.

VizCom bridges this gap. It is an AI-powered visualization tool that allows users to upload a photo of themselves or their surroundings and instantly see how products, styles, or designs would look in real life. Unlike simple editing tools, VizCom is directly connected with real products from commerce platforms. That means when a user tries on a shirt, places a sofa, or experiments with a lipstick shade, they aren’t just seeing a mockup—they can click through to the exact item and purchase it.

title: Mischef ;)
subtitle: Mischef ends the dinner-time guesswork by turning a photo of your ingredients into a simple, visual recipe that guides you perfectly through
description:
Mischef ends the dinner-time guesswork by turning a photo of your ingredients into a simple, visual recipe that guides you perfectly through

For the busy professional or the health-conscious home cook, the daily question of "what's for dinner?" is often a source of stress. First, there's the cognitive load of planning: using search to sift through endless food blogs, trying to find one recipe that meets your dietary needs and uses up ingredients before they spoil. Then, there's the friction of execution. Even after finding a recipe, you're left trying to interpret dense paragraphs of text—constantly re-reading steps with messy hands and struggling to visualize what "sauté until translucent" actually looks like. This entire process is riddled with guesswork, turning what should be a relaxing, therapeutic activity into a chore.

Mischef is an AI culinary co-pilot designed to eliminate that friction and bring the joy back to the kitchen. It starts with a simple photo of the ingredients you already have on hand. From there, Mischef handles all the heavy lifting: identifying what's usable, understanding your personal dietary preferences (like "vegetarian" or "gluten-free"), and generating three distinct, creative recipe suggestions in seconds. The result is a seamless journey from a chaotic fridge to a delicious, personalized meal, giving you back the mental space to simply enjoy the process of cooking.

title: Simplifying Group Photos with Post Compose 📸
subtitle: Pose Compose is uses Nano Banana to turn individual photos in social events or travel settings into a photoreal composite group shot!
description:
Pose Compose is uses Nano Banana to turn individual photos in social events or travel settings into a photoreal composite group shot!

• Subject isolation. We use Gemini’s image understanding to remove backgrounds and
preserve hair, edges, and proportions.
• Identity and style consistency. Across multiple inputs, Gemini keeps faces, clothing, and
lighting style coherent so the final group looks like one session.
• Edit with words. Users describe poses, gaze, and micro-expressions in natural language.
Gemini positions subjects, adjusts posture, and refines hands and eye lines.
• Fusion and relighting. Gemini blends subjects into a chosen scene with perspective
correction, color temperature match, directional shadows, contact points, and occlusion
handling.
• Context reasoning. World knowledge helps scale people relative to landmarks and align
horizon lines for realism.
• Layout and output optimization. Gemini composes for Instagram, LinkedIn, and print
aspect ratios with crop-safe margins.
• Interactive refinement. Users can say “move Alex closer,” “make lighting warmer,” or
“add soft shadow under feet.” Gemini applies edits without manual masks.

These capabilities transform group photography from a scheduling problem into a fast, natural
language workflow that produces images indistinguishable from a single real shoot.

description:
Discover and Convert your existing wardrobe to obscure folk arts around the world.

I come from a state in India which has a lot of really cool folk arts. However, many are slowly disappearing due to lack of support and low exposure. Since I'm a student of AI, I'm aware of the backlash that Image Generation models face from artists. But maybe we are looking at the problem differently. The ability of Nano-Banana to edit images, especially outfits on subjects in an image, to almost pixel-perfect designs might be useful in bridging the gap between these ancient traditions and a modern, digital audience.

My project is a platform that uses this exact capability. Anyone can upload a photo and instantly see their own outfit transformed into a beautiful canvas for these endangered art forms. Instead of replacing artists, we are using AI as a tool for amplification and discovery.

title: Comic Book AI
subtitle: Watch your stories come to life easier.
description:
Google Hackathon Project Overview
Nerrame is a revolutionary AI-powered comic creation platform that serves as "Canva for comics with a built-in Story Brain." The platform transforms comic creation from a complex artistic endeavor into an accessible creative experience for creators of all skill levels.
At its core, Nerrame features a comprehensive Story Bible system where users define their comic's world once—characters, settings, tone, and art style—then generate consistent comic pages while maintaining visual and narrative coherence. Users can create comics panel-by-panel with custom prompts or use one-click page generation that automatically creates all panels based on the script.
The platform includes robust community functionality with a public explore page, user profiles, and comprehensive sharing system. Comics can be toggled between private and public, with shareable links for external viewing. The integrated Character Library allows creators to build reusable character assets across projects.
Key features include intelligent context-aware panel editing, transparent credit system (250 credits/month for users), auto-save functionality, responsive design, and professional UI/UX standards. The platform seamlessly blends creative freedom with AI assistance, making comic creation accessible while maintaining professional quality standards essential for winning the Nano Banana Hackathon.

Gemini 2.5 Flash Image Features Usage
Gemini 2.5 Flash Image Generation is the cornerstone of Nerrame Studio's creative engine, powering every visual element of the comic creation process.
Core Implementation: The platform leverages Gemini 2.5 Flash's advanced image generation capabilities through a sophisticated context-aware system. Each panel generation request combines the user's Story Bible (characters, settings, art style) with specific panel prompts to ensure visual consistency across entire comic projects.
Intelligent Context Integration: When users generate panels, the system automatically incorporates character descriptions, established art styles, and narrative context from previous panels. This creates seamless visual storytelling where characters maintain consistent appearances and the overall aesthetic remains cohesive throughout the comic.

Advanced Features Utilized
Dynamic scene composition for varying panel layouts
Character consistency through detailed prompt engineering
Art style preservation across multiple generations
Background generation with environmental context
Panel-specific customization while maintaining story coherence
Central to Application: Gemini 2.5 Flash isn't just a feature—it's the creative backbone. Without it, Nerrame couldn't deliver its core promise: transforming text-based stories into visually stunning comics. The AI's ability to understand context, maintain consistency, and generate high-quality imagery makes professional comic creation accessible to creators regardless of artistic skill level.

description:
A workflow for Ai video collaboration. A web app that helps teams stay on the same page while they film and restyle video clips.

This weekend I worked first to integrate nano banana into a collaborative video framework. As the founder of 10zebra, I already had many things in place for a webapp focused on video. This hackathon inspired me to push on a novel use case - Specifically to leverage advanced image editing not just for new images but for new VIDEO creation anchored by the image edits. We carried through a full design sprint with production code and real world application testing. Then the next day I used the software for a real test case: collaborative music video creation. I worked with Sultan Sharrief and Dulce Baerga to make the music video. Sultan brought his background researching his own DNA, media and ancestral relations - channeled into the dance, which is about forming a connection with our past and it's collision with new media. Dulce Baerga worked with Eleven Labs Music to create our song. Nothing like meeting up with creative strangers to make something that would have been impossible just last month!

This is a link to our webapp where you can see how we restyled video with nano banana.

title: Comic Book AI
subtitle: Watch your stories come to life easier.
description:
Google Hackathon Project Overview
Nerrame is a revolutionary AI-powered comic creation platform that serves as "Canva for comics with a built-in Story Brain." The platform transforms comic creation from a complex artistic endeavor into an accessible creative experience for creators of all skill levels.
At its core, Nerrame features a comprehensive Story Bible system where users define their comic's world once—characters, settings, tone, and art style—then generate consistent comic pages while maintaining visual and narrative coherence. Users can create comics panel-by-panel with custom prompts or use one-click page generation that automatically creates all panels based on the script.
The platform includes robust community functionality with a public explore page, user profiles, and comprehensive sharing system. Comics can be toggled between private and public, with shareable links for external viewing. The integrated Character Library allows creators to build reusable character assets across projects.
Key features include intelligent context-aware panel editing, transparent credit system (250 credits/month for users), auto-save functionality, responsive design, and professional UI/UX standards. The platform seamlessly blends creative freedom with AI assistance, making comic creation accessible while maintaining professional quality standards essential for winning the Nano Banana Hackathon.

Gemini 2.5 Flash Image Features Usage
Gemini 2.5 Flash Image Generation is the cornerstone of Nerrame Studio's creative engine, powering every visual element of the comic creation process.
Core Implementation: The platform leverages Gemini 2.5 Flash's advanced image generation capabilities through a sophisticated context-aware system. Each panel generation request combines the user's Story Bible (characters, settings, art style) with specific panel prompts to ensure visual consistency across entire comic projects.
Intelligent Context Integration: When users generate panels, the system automatically incorporates character descriptions, established art styles, and narrative context from previous panels. This creates seamless visual storytelling where characters maintain consistent appearances and the overall aesthetic remains cohesive throughout the comic.

Advanced Features Utilized
Dynamic scene composition for varying panel layouts
Character consistency through detailed prompt engineering
Art style preservation across multiple generations
Background generation with environmental context
Panel-specific customization while maintaining story coherence
Central to Application: Gemini 2.5 Flash isn't just a feature—it's the creative backbone. Without it, Nerrame couldn't deliver its core promise: transforming text-based stories into visually stunning comics. The AI's ability to understand context, maintain consistency, and generate high-quality imagery makes professional comic creation accessible to creators regardless of artistic skill level.

Aurat Ki Awaz is a web app empowering women across developing countries like Pakistan to confront domestic violence and other atrocities with cutting-edge AI technology. The platform offers a secure, anonymous haven for any woman to record her story in local languages like Urdu or Hindi, no tech expertise needed. Powered by ElevenLabs’ advanced AI, recordings are swiftly transcribed into empathetic reports, enriched with legal references like Pakistan’s Women’s Protection Act for impact. The app generates an anonymized, natural female voice using ElevenLabs Text-to-Voice feature safeguarding identities while keeping the tone intact. Hosted on Firebase, reports are shared via encrypted, expiring links with trusted NGOs and lawyers, ensuring privacy. A one-tap “Help Me” button triggers instant alerts,. Aurat Ki Awaz fuses state-of-the-art AI, robust security, and intuitive design to give every woman in developing nations a fearless voice for justice.

title: CODE PORTRAIT ARCADE: Forging Developer Avatars with Gemini
subtitle: A Generative AI Experience that Visualizes Your GitHub Identity
description:
CODE PORTRAIT ARCADE is powered by the Gemini 2.5 Flash Image model, which serves as both the analytical and creative core of the application.

Our system uses Gemini in two fundamental ways. First, for text-to-image "Portrait Mode," Gemini analyzes a developer's GitHub profile to generate a detailed, context-aware prompt. Gemini extends its creative reasoning to enrich these prompts, adding symbolic objects for programming languages (like a coffee mug for Java) and distinct visual styles for different tech domains (e.g., cyberpunk for backend). This creates a symbolic portrait that visually represents the developer's unique coding identity.

The true innovation shines in our image-to-image "Remix Mode." Here, we leverage Gemini's advanced multi-modal capabilities by providing it with two inputs: the user's GitHub profile picture and the AI-generated personality prompt. Gemini masterfully fuses these elements, enhancing the original photo with artistic stylizations that reflect the developer's coding archetype. This deep personalization, blending a real-world image with abstract professional traits, is a unique capability unlocked by Gemini 2.5 Flash Image. It transforms a simple avatar into a meaningful "Code Portrait," offering a cool and practical tool for the developer community.

description:
Our app taps into Gemini 2.5 Flash Image to turn basic sketches into polished assets ready for 3D work. We also make the most of its prompt-based tweaks, where users can pick styles like animals, anime characters, or clothing. It's a breeze for newbies and experts to steer the AI toward what they want without much hassle.
Plus, the super-quick processing means instant results, making the whole sketch-to-3D flow feel effortless and fun. All in all, by blending sketch fixes, background tweaks, and style options, Gemini 2.5 Flash Image is the powerhouse behind our creative process—turning wild ideas into clean 3D models in no time.

description:
Use Nano banana to generate orthographic views for a multi view 3D model generator to accuracy of final output.

Image to 3D models CAN generate from just a single reference image. However, there can be unexpected results as the model is unable to "see" what detail should be modelled where the detail is not visible from the current view angle. If multiple images are provided, the results are much better and more stable.

Nano-banana is very good at generating views of the same character/object from different camera angles. This is great for generating the front, back, side views which are often used in the manual 3D modelling process.

title: BananaScope: AI-Powered Infinite Image Zoom
subtitle: Explore images infinitely with AI-powered zoom that generates realistic details at every level, turning pixelation into endless discovery
description:
Explore images infinitely with AI-powered zoom that generates realistic details at every level, turning pixelation into endless discovery

The model receives base64-encoded PNG images of the viewport (typically 800x600 pixels) and processes them using the prompt: "Enhance this image with better detail, sharper textures, and realistic improvements while maintaining the original style." Gemini's multimodal understanding allows it to recognize image content - whether it's architecture, nature, or abstract patterns - and generate contextually appropriate enhancements.
Each enhancement creates a new base image at 100% zoom, enabling users to zoom in again for another enhancement cycle. This creates theoretically infinite zoom depth, with Gemini generating progressively finer details at each level. The model maintains visual consistency across enhancements, ensuring smooth transitions between zoom levels.
The integration is optimized for performance through viewport-based processing (only the visible area is enhanced), intelligent caching to avoid redundant API calls, and request debouncing. This makes Gemini 2.5 Flash Image the core engine powering the application's unique infinite exploration capability.

title: Foresight Engine
subtitle: An AI Future-Prediction Engine Based on Time-Series Imagery
description:
The Foresight Engine tackles the challenge of predictive visual analysis from sparse, real-world images. We utilized three core features of the Gemini 1.5 Flash model. First, its million-token long context window is central to our application, allowing the model to analyze an entire sequence of high-resolution construction photos at once to understand the overall pace and direction of a project. Second, its deep multimodal reasoning enables it to connect visual evidence (like scaffolding patterns) with its built-in knowledge of engineering processes to make logical inferences. Finally, its image generation capability allows it to translate this complex analysis into a single, photorealistic image of a predicted future state. These features together allow Foresight Engine to transform a series of static past images into a insightful glimpse of the future.

This project is a submission for the Kaggle Nano-Banana Hackathon. This project is a submission for

description:
Brandana is an innovative AI marketing platform that transforms your brand logo into professional, platform-optimized marketing assets. Powered by "Bananagent," a specialized AI agent, Brandana creates stunning visual content for X (Twitter), YouTube, Instagram, LinkedIn, Facebook, email campaigns, and presentations.

The Gemini API serves as Brandana's intelligent prompt enhancement engine. When users upload their logo and select platforms, Gemini analyzes the brand context and generates sophisticated, detailed prompts optimized for visual AI generation. It processes brand colors, logo descriptions, and platform-specific requirements to create comprehensive instructions that ensure each marketing asset maintains brand consistency while meeting platform standards. Gemini's advanced language understanding transforms basic user inputs into complex, technical prompts that specify exact dimensions, logo placement (minimum 40% visibility), color schemes, composition guidelines, and visual style requirements. This intelligent prompt generation ensures that the subsequent image generation (via Fal.ai) produces professional-quality backgrounds perfectly suited for logo overlay.

The seamless integration between Gemini's prompt intelligence and Fal.ai's image generation capabilities enables Brandana to deliver complete, branded marketing assets that maintain visual impact and professional quality across all digital platforms, making it an essential tool for modern brand marketing.

description:
Our project, The Automated Cinematic Concept Art Generator, converts raw film scripts into storyboard-style concept art while preserving input character designs across all scenes.

The workflow begins with intelligent script deconstruction: identifying characters, parsing scene boundaries, and analyzing mood, action, and setting. For each scene, the system dynamically assembles a cinematic prompt enriched with both narrative details and the canonical visual identity of the characters present.

Using Gemini 2.5 Flash Image’s advanced editing and consistency features, the generator injects the required characters directly into each scene. This ensures that their design remains coherent—whether in a wide aerial establishing shot, an over-the-shoulder dialogue, or a dimly lit close-up.

Gemini’s image editing capabilities allow players to apply natural text-based modifications, such as changing lighting, props, or environmental details, while keeping core characters intact. Story and choice generation use Gemini text models to create structured scene prompts and branching options, forming the interactive RPG adventure.

ElevenLabs is integrated for voice narration and optional background music, creating an immersive audio-visual experience. The final assembly is performed in-browser using the Canvas and Web Audio APIs, rendering a playable adventure video. Gemini is central to this workflow, powering character design, scene generation, and dynamic edits, enabling a fully AI-driven RPG storytelling experience that is visually coherent, interactive, and magical.

title: DrawGPT Looper - Loop Your Nano Banana Prompts
subtitle: Loop your Nano Banana prompts to get a consistent series of images.
description:
Loop Your Prompts!
DrawGPT Looper lets you loop your Nano Banana prompts! This is a fun and unusual take a new prompt modality which is a "loop" allowing you to replay a prompt repeatedly on successive prompt outputs.
How to Use Looper?
Upload an image or enter a prompt then set the number of "loops" you want to make on that prompt and any input assets. Then it will sit and iterate on your prompt! It's a fun little tool to see what Nano Banana and these multimodal enabled LLMs can do.
Why Prompt Looping?
This is a somewhat esoteric project in that its not likely to be a commercial success but it does explore a "loop" prompt modality. The limits of modern multimodal AI models can be seen easily, for example by asking Nano Banana to complete a visual series using DrawGPT Looper. This started as an exercise in exploring generational drift & AI entropy and ended being a fun little exercise around a new way to think about prompting.
Try It Out!
Link: https://drawgpt.ai/looper/
YouTube Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R2yxejJeNEg

You can use this to loop prompts to create a series of images, small animation, and more.

Kickiniteasy. DrawGPT Looper - Loop Your Nano Banana Prompts. https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/banana/writeups/drawgpt-looper-loop-your-nano-banana-prompts. 2025. Kaggle

title: Stage Your Home
subtitle: Use AI to professionally stage and photograph an unfurnished home
description:
When you are buying, selling or leasing a house, the realtor typically asks you to remove all furniture and get the house painted. They may then get it staged professionally. Staging means adding furniture, artwork etc. to make the house look more appealing to the buyers. It also helps potential buyers get an idea of the space and how it can be used.

They then get the house photographed for the listing. At this point, if the house is not staged, the photographs in the real estate listing are usualy bare rooms and potential buyers or tenants may not be able to visualize the space well. Or if the house is staged, the seller needs to pay for the staging service and they also have limited creative inputs and don't know what the end product will look like.

This project aims to solve this problem by using AI to stage the house and generate photographs.

title: Dino Banana: Surgical Image Editing
subtitle: Leveraging Nano Banana with an Image Feature Extractor to Combine Natural Language Editing with ML Assisted Manual Selection
description:
Leveraging Nano Banana with an Image Feature Extractor to Combine Natural Language Editing with ML Assisted Manual Selection

I have created a proof of concept by merging DINOv3*'s capabilities with nano-bananas', to achieve control that's beyond natural language guiding.
Specifically, the application helps to hand the model only the subject, and the change that's needed on that subject only, *without touching or referencing rest of the image*.
This approach also helps with multi-stage editing, an aspect where models like nano-banana fall short.

I have cloned the DINOv3 Web Space from HuggingFace, and added the following mechanisms: additive selection where multiple selections will be added on top of each other, negative-positive selection with unselecting, feather mask around rough pixel patches, real-time viewing of what parts will be export and real-time export threshold for pixel patch activations, cutting from / pasting back into original place, and Gemini API calls.

title: AI Room Furniture Placer
subtitle: Visualize Amazon Furniture in Your Space
description:
This Chrome extension uses Gemini 2.5 Flash Image (Nano Banana) to place furniture realistically in room photos. Users can upload a room image, pick furniture from Amazon, and see how it looks instantly.

The AI understands room lighting, shadows, perspective, and furniture details. By drawing a yellow box, users tell the AI where to place the item. The model removes existing objects in that spot and blends the new furniture naturally.

With prompt-based customization for different furniture types, the extension creates results that look professionally edited. Gemini 2.5 makes interior visualization easy for anyone—no design or photo editing skills needed.

title: Branchlight: Visual Storytelling with Gemini-Powered Narrative Branching
subtitle: A prompt-to-storyboard tool that uses Gemini 2.5 Flash to generate interleaved text and visuals with customizable branching narratives.
description:
A prompt-to-storyboard tool that uses Gemini 2.5 Flash to generate interleaved text and visuals with customizable branching narratives.

Storytelling is rarely linear, and creativity doesn’t follow a straight line. With Branchlight, we built an interactive storytelling tool that empowers users to go from a single prompt to a multi-branch visual narrative, all within seconds.

Branchlight introduces a branching engine where users can explore multiple paths from any scene. Instead of being locked into one story arc, creators can use the ✚ button to explore alternate futures, emotions, or genres while the model maintains narrative cohesion. This gives users more control over their story’s direction.

title: Mendel's Garden
subtitle: grow fused creatures
description:
Mendel’s Garden uses Gemini 2.5 Flash + Flash Image end-to-end to turn two inputs (names or photos) into a living “hybrid” that grows over time. First, Gemini 2.5 Flash performs multimodal understanding with structured JSON output: from an image or text, it returns the subject’s common/scientific name, category (plant/animal/human), and a short description. That schema drives the UI and safety gates and makes the experience deterministic and fast.

We then prompt Flash/Flash Image for three core capabilities central to the app:

Fusion: The hybrid “offspring” is synthesized by explicitly blending traits from both parents (text or photo-identified). The model names the hybrid, proposes a scientific name, and produces the first visual (seed/egg/newborn) reflecting parent attributes.

title: StoryMagic: AI-Powered Personalized Children's Story Creator
subtitle: StoryMagic - Where Every Child Becomes the Hero of Their Own Story
description:
Character Consistency enables the same child character to appear identically across the scenes - a breakthrough that wasn't achievable with previous image AI. Parents upload one photo, and our system generates their child as an illustrated protagonist that remains visually consistent throughout the adventure.

Combined with Gemini's world knowledge, StoryMagic generates age-appropriate, educational narratives that adapt to each scene. The integration with ElevenLabs' advanced continuity features creates seamless narration across the entire story - we leverage their continuity related parameters to maintain consistent voice characteristics, pacing, and emotional tone as the story progresses from page to page. This means the narrator doesn't sound disjointed between scenes; instead, each page flows naturally into the next with preserved intonation patterns and speaking style, creating a truly immersive multi-sensory storytelling experience.

This dual consistency - visual through Gemini and auditory through ElevenLabs - solves a real problem: parents struggle to find truly personalized books featuring their children, and existing solutions can't maintain character consistency across multiple illustrations or provide smooth, connected narration throughout an entire story.

title: Project Chimera
subtitle: "Generating novel images through multi-source input fusion and combinatorial synthesis."
description:
"Generating novel images through multi-source input fusion and combinatorial synthesis."

Nano Banana Hackathon Submission
Project Chimera: Powered by Gemini Integration
At the heart of Project Chimera lies the powerful multimodal engine of the Gemini 2.5 Flash Image model. The core of our application is its ability to perform sophisticated image editing and synthesis by combining complex user inputs: a main image, multiple reference images, and a dynamically generated, highly detailed text prompt.
The key Gemini feature we leverage is its advanced multimodal understanding. This enables users to seamlessly fuse concepts, styles, and elements from various sources. For example, a user can provide an image of a character, an image of a futuristic armor set, and an image of a specific art style, and then direct the process with a detailed text prompt such as, "Apply the armor to the character, rendered in the specified art style, while maintaining the original pose."
This deep comprehension of instructions is critical. Our application dynamically constructs prompts that combine dozens of custom parameters, ranging from deleting specific elements and changing poses to applying complex textures and even "evolving" a character. Gemini's ability to parse and execute these layered instructions is what makes Project Chimera a versatile and powerful creative tool, transforming a single prompt into a comprehensive command center for image manipulation.
The features showcased in this hackathon represent just the starting point of Project Chimera's core potential. Moving forward, we plan to actively integrate more of Gemini's advanced features to revolutionize the user experience and push the boundaries of creative expression. The true potential of Project Chimera is only just beginning to unfold.

title: Co-Creative Canvas
subtitle: Real-time collaborative drawing platform with intelligent image fusion and creation
description:
Real-time collaborative drawing platform with intelligent image fusion and creation

Co-Creative Canvas addresses the fundamental challenge of visual collaboration in remote and hybrid work environments. Traditional collaborative tools force teams to choose between real-time interaction and AI-powered creativity, but never both simultaneously. title: Travel Pose: Be at any World Monument
subtitle: TravelPose uses Gemini 2.5 Flash Image to let users place themselves in front of iconic monuments with consistent identity, realistic lighti
description:
TravelPose uses Gemini 2.5 Flash Image to let users place themselves in front of iconic monuments with consistent identity, realistic lighti

My app, TravelPose, lets users place themselves in front of iconic monuments with realistic lighting and proportions. At this stage, the app supports a curated set of world monuments (Eiffel Tower, Taj Mahal, Burj Khalifa, etc.), allowing us to focus on quality and seamless blending.

We used Gemini 2.5 Flash Image to power the core experience:
• Face & Body Consistency: Gemini ensures uploaded images maintain the same identity and proportions across different monuments.
• Lighting & Shadow Matching: By parsing natural language prompts, Gemini automatically adjusts sunlight, shadows, and tones so the subject blends naturally into the monument background.
• Natural Language Editing: Users simply type, “Put me at the Taj Mahal at sunrise, travel-blogger style”, and Gemini generates a polished result without manual editing.
• Scalability: The current set of monuments is a proof of concept, but the system is designed to scale to more destinations, natural wonders, and even events.

The online fashion industry/E-commerce stores are built on a fundamental challenge: the "imagination gap." A customer sees a dress on a model and has to guess how it might look on them. This uncertainty leads to cart abandonment and staggering return rates—a headache for consumers and a massive financial and environmental cost for retailers.

I built StyleSnap to close that gap. It’s not just another virtual try-on tool; it’s an intelligent styling system designed for accuracy and reliability, powered by a collaborative team of AI agents.

Nano Closet turns product screenshots into a personal closet and lets you try them on yourself in seconds—powered by Gemini 2.5 Flash

Nano Closet is a local-first virtual wardrobe that transforms product links and screenshots into a personal closet, and enables photorealistic virtual try-on directly on a user’s selfie. Unlike cloud-based fashion apps, Nano Closet runs entirely on a local API with optional cloud opt-in, ensuring that user photos and try-on results never leave their device.

The system combines an Angular progressive web app (PWA) with a lightweight image processing engine powered by Gemini 2.5 Flash “Nano Banana.” Garments are extracted from e-commerce images or screenshots with fine detail preservation, then composited onto selfies with realistic alignment, lighting, and occlusion behind hair and arms. Users can stack multiple items, adjust scale and placement, and export outfits seamlessly.

title: From Beats to Frames: Gemini 2.5 Flash Image Pipeline
subtitle: Text-free Late Han storytelling in 24 cinematic panels.
description:
Technically, we call chat.send_message(prompt) and read the returned image parts through part.as_image(). A custom extractor supports multiple return shapes (repr_png, repr_jpeg, image_bytes, data-URI) so images can be saved programmatically and reviewed. We added a tiny retry and a rerender_panel(idx=…) helper to quickly regenerate any single frame while preserving filenames and prompts.

Gemini is central because it enables rapid storyboard-to-screen iteration: high-quality frames at Flash speed, controllable via prompt engineering (era cues, lighting, composition), which we then sync to narration. Voiceover is recorded separately (ElevenLabs) and edited with MoviePy, but the core visual creation—the images themselves and our ability to refine them quickly—depends on Gemini 2.5 Flash Image.

title: Nanocation - Your Educational Adventure
subtitle: The AI-powered creative toolkit for educators and students. Turn any lesson into a visual masterpiece with the magic of Nano Banana!
description:
The AI-powered creative toolkit for educators and students. Turn any lesson into a visual masterpiece with the magic of Nano Banana!

Education is magical, but the tools we use often aren't. We were inspired by the challenge educators face in finding or creating high-quality, specific visual aids for their lessons. Stock photos are generic, and creating custom graphics is time-consuming. We envisioned a tool that could act as a creative assistant for teachers and a playground for students, a place where any concept could be visualized instantly. Nanocation was born from this idea: to make learning unforgettable by making it visual.

Nanocation is a web-based AI toolkit powered by Gemini that transforms text and images into stunning educational visuals. It's a one-stop-shop for creative learning, offering five distinct tools:
Science Sketchpad: Generates clear, textbook-quality scientific diagrams from a simple description. Users can even provide a style reference image to guide the AI.
Comic Creator: Turns any lesson or story into a fun comic strip. The magic here is that users can upload their own photo to become the star of their educational adventure!
History Time Machine: A portal to the past! Users upload a photo and describe a historical scene to see themselves realistically placed in a different era.
Future You!: Allows students to visualize their future careers. Upload a photo, describe a profession, and see yourself as a firefighter, an astronaut, or a marine biologist.
Invention Studio: Sparks curiosity and engineering thinking. Users can upload a photo of an object and ask the AI to reveal its inner workings with a detailed cutaway view or transform it into something completely new.

description:
The ProdViz AI application enables users to effortlessly place and contextualize 3D models of products into real-world environments. It solves the common problem faced by designers and marketers who need to create high-quality, realistic product mockups without the cost and time of traditional photography or complex 3D rendering.

The core of the application is powered by Gemini 2.5 Flash Image's advanced multimodal capabilities. Users provide two inputs: an image of the 3D model and a text prompt describing the desired scene. The model's visual reasoning analyzes the input image to understand the product's form, color, and texture, while its native multimodal architecture seamlessly combines this understanding with the text prompt. This allows for a precise, prompt-based editing process that places the product into a new, complex scene, such as "in front of a hotel," while maintaining the subject's identity and visual consistency. AI Try-On is a Chrome extension that transforms online fashion shopping by letting you see yourself in the clothes before buying. When browsing Amazon.co.jp’s fashion pages, the extension replaces the product’s main image with an AI-generated photo of you wearing the selected item. Setup is simple: install the extension, enter your Gemini API key, and upload your portrait. From there, just toggle a button and within seconds the extension generates a realistic try-on image, keeping your face, pose, and background unchanged while swapping only the clothing.

Google’s Nano Banana is integral to this project because it bridges your portrait and the product photo seamlessly. By leveraging Gemini through Nano Banana, the extension achieves high-quality garment replacement while preserving natural textures, lighting, and realism. This precise integration ensures the generated image looks authentic, making online shopping more engaging and helping solve one of fashion e-commerce’s biggest problems: visualizing how clothes will actually look on you.

A personalized gifting app that generates hilarious book covers for the recipient along with the entire book

HookMyBook is an application that allows users to create unique, personalized books as gifts. A critical and highly personal element of this experience is the book cover, which must feature the recipient while matching the book's chosen genre and tone. The primary challenge was to automate the creation of high-quality, custom book covers instantly, a task that would traditionally require manual graphic design work.

This application leverages the advanced image-to-image generation capabilities of the Gemini 2.5 Flash Image model. The model is central to solving the cover creation problem. It takes a user-uploaded photograph and, following a detailed prompt, seamlessly replaces the background, integrates the original subjects into a new scene, and intelligently adds text elements like the title, subtitle, and author's name. By preserving the people in the photo while completely reimagining their environment, Gemini 2.5 Flash Image acts as an automated "in-painting" and scene creation engine, turning a simple photo into a professional and contextually relevant book cover in seconds. This feature is the cornerstone of the app's personalization-at-scale promise.

Living Meeple addresses a common challenge in education: dense, historical texts are often unengaging for young and visual learners. The tool acts as a multi-modal AI storyteller, automatically transforming any block of historical text into a lively, kid-friendly audiovisual experience that is easy to comprehend and retain.

The process is driven by a sophisticated AI pipeline. First, a Gemini text model acts as a "Storyboard Director," analyzing the source text to generate a structured JSON plan. First, the image + text-to-image (editing) capability is used to take a user's uploaded photo and a description of a dress, then merge them. The model intelligently places the dress onto the user's body. Second, character consistency is vital. This feature ensures that the user's face, body, and overall likeness remain consistent and recognisable in the final output, regardless of the dress or pose. This avoids the common problem of AI-generated people looking like different individuals. Lastly, the model's multi-image fusion lets it combine the dress image and the person's photo, creating a cohesive and realistic new image. These features collectively enable the core "virtual try-on" experience.

title: Drone Show StoryBoard
subtitle: A web application that uses Gemini 2.5 Flash's image editing capabilities to transform text prompts and photos into animated drone light
description:
A web application that uses Gemini 2.5 Flash's image editing capabilities to transform text prompts and photos into animated drone light

The primary mechanism is iterative image editing, where the model uses an existing image as a visual reference for creating the next one. This image-plus-text prompting is central to "Animation," "Story," and "Director" modes. In each, an initial keyframe is generated, and subsequent frames are created by providing the model with the previous image and a new text prompt. This ensures absolute stylistic consistency and smooth visual transitions, which are critical for believable animation sequences. In "Director Mode," the user provides these prompts manually, while in other modes, the AI generates them.

The second core feature is advanced style transfer, used exclusively in "Upload Mode." Here, the model takes a user's uploaded image and a detailed stylistic prompt to intelligently redraw the subject into minimalist, transparent-background line art.
